description: The showdown that fans have been waiting for begins here, as Manji and Shira finally cross paths! Although he’s missing an arm, Manji’s mystical healing powers still ensure that he’s a formidable opponent—but his greatest foe, the masochistic Shira, has a few depraved tricks up his own sleeves! With Shira deadlier than ever, having had plenty of time to plot twisted revenge schemes, will Manji be able to protect Rin from his deranged nemesis? Plus—an Ittö-ryü warrior dies, in typically dramatic Hiroaki Samura fashion. Samura's widely acclaimed Blade of the Immortal manga series has won awards across the globe, including the Eisner Award in America, the prestigious Media Arts Award of Japan, and multiple British Eagle Awards.
name: Vol. 25

volume.name: Blade of the Immortal: Snowfall at Dawn

name: 17 May 1975
5 July 1975

description: In the "Letters to Batman" conclusion, Batman learns a lesson about the way he looks at crime...that helps him solve one!
name: Letters to Batman, Part 3 of 3

description:
Major Eazy is a maverick soldier in a dirty war, and determined to see justice done. Even when that means taking on the villains on his own side, he doesn't pull any punches!

More movie-star than military, Eazy was the most laconic and indeed British officer ever to grace the pages of Battle Picture Weekly. This volume returns to Eazy's first campaign in Africa, where many surprises await.
name: The African Campaign

description:
War is a dirty business... so who better than criminals to fight it? When Major Taggart breaks four military convicts out of jail, they think they’re headed for Easy Street... but they couldn’t be more wrong. Before, they were scum — now they’re rats!

Matthew Dancer: thief and knifeman. Ronald Weasel: safe-cracker. “The Turk”: muscle. Joe Rogan: athleticism.
name: Guns, Guts and Glory

name: Rough Justice

description:
Early Titan colour collection reprinting the John Wagner and Mike McMahon stories from the first two Judge Dredd annuals (1981 and 1982).

Cover: Mike McMahon (Judge Dredd)

  • Judge Dredd - Pinboing Wizard (reprint from Judge Dredd Annual 1981) (John Wagner - Mike McMahon)
  • Judge Dredd - Compulsory Purchase! (reprint from Judge Dredd Annual 1981) (John Wagner - Mike McMahon)
  • Judge Dredd - The Fear That Made Milwaukee Famous! (reprint from Judge Dredd Annual 1981) (John Wagner - Mike McMahon)
  • Judge Dredd - Anatomy of a Crime! (reprint from Judge Dredd Annual 1982) (John Wagner - Mike McMahon)
  • Judge Dredd - The Vampire Effect (reprint from Judge Dredd Annual 1982) (John Wagner - Mike McMahon)
name: Streets of Mega-City

volume.name: Judge Dredd the Streets of Mega-City

description: Worlds of Phazer is a unique compilation of stories tracing the origin of Phazer and the first appearances of popular guest stars, Golden Age Heroes, Nova Girls, Blackray, Agent Three Zero, Blue Sultan, Shadowflame, Team Kaiju, Witch Hunter, Pistolfist, El Gato Negro, Penance, and Captain Action!

Tommy Monaghan faces a plague of the undead and goes toe-to-toe with assassin Ringo Chen! Plus, Tommy crosses paths with LOBO and the JUSTICE LEAGUE! Collecting HITMAN #51-60, HITMAN/LOBO: THE STUPID BASTICH #1, JLA/HITMAN #1-2 and a story from SUPERMAN 80-PAGE GIANT #1.

Back Blurb.

Last Call.

It's been a hard couple of months for Tommy Monaghan, Gotham City's top hitman. The stark reality of his profession has been brought home to him as never before, and once again those closest to him have paid for the price. The good news is that he survived. The bad news is that it's going to get a whole lot worse.

After a lifetime of beating the odds, Tommy and all the other regulars at Noona's Bar are about to face their final reckoning. Enduring grudges, long-standing feuds, festering old wounds --- everything is coming out into the open, and the only question left is whether or not some good can yet come from approaching firestorm.

Collecting issues 51-60 of the blood-soaked series, HITMAN: CLOSING TIME brings writer Garth Ennis and artist John McCrea's tale of Gotham's fastest gun to its blazing conclusion. The final volume in the HITMAN saga also includes the two-issue code JUSTICE LEAGUE/HITMAN and the legendary frag-fest HITMAN/LOBO, featuring art by Dough Mahnke

description: It's all been leading to this: the stakes are high, the chips are down and the cards are on the table as Blue Estate 's critically-acclaimed first season goes out with a bang! See who gets what they deserve, who deserves what they get and who winds up in body bags as the 100% cool Hollywood crime saga explodes in a gun-blazing, house-razing grand finale! (Don't miss the extras at www.BlueEstateComic.com.)
name: Serenity
